page.title: 02Maristow Estate.
page.content: The main landowner is the Rt. Honourable Henry Lopes. This estate has been in the family since the 1720's. The first owner being Sir Ralph Lopes. The estate has passed down to the present Lord Roborough's son, Mr. Henry who took over in 1975. At one time there had been as much as 960 acres and some 62 farms. Today there are some 620 acres with a great reduction in farms and farm workers. A government scheme encouraged the amalgamation of adjacent farms,grants were awarded for the removing of hedges, thus accomodating larger more modern machinery. While beef cattle have been the predominant source of income, two flocks of sheep,deep litter hens and pig farming are also an important part of farm life,along with the showing of South Devon and Jersey cattle.
